body: One thing we could do is to limit the number of inflight read requests. I don't have workload to work on it now. PR is welcome!
This bug is preventing some of our customers from using cache compression. Could this be bumped higher than a P3?

The patch suggested by @sluongng does not appear to help. I think because [`RecyclingBufferPool`](https://github.com/luben/zstd-jni/blob/e07f8970be0c72ce02dcdf1877daa034208915d0/src/main/java/com/github/luben/zstd/RecyclingBufferPool.java) does not impose any limit on the size of the pool. If concurrent use requires an additional buffer, the pool grows. So overall it does not meaningfully change the behavior when there are many concurrent decompression streams.

> This bug is preventing some of our customers from using cache compression. Could this be bumped higher than a P3?

@coeuvre @tjgq Do we have plan to rollout this experimental feature? If so, maybe P3 isn't appropriate?
